mullan.sean.coinz

Class Data

  • java.lang.Object
    • mullan.sean.coinz.Data

  • public final class Data
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves as the applications global data structure that stores the relevant data accessible from all fragments so that no two fragments have to communicate between each other. These methods handle all uploading to and downloading from firebase.

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void acceptFriendRequest(User friend)
      Performs three steps to accept a friend request: 1) Remove friend from users requests subcollection 2) Add friend to users friends subcollection 3) Add user to the requester's friends subcollection
      static void addCoinToCollection(Coin coin, java.lang.String collection, OnEventListener<java.lang.Integer> event)
      The specified coin is added to the specified collection and corresponding ArrayList.
      static void addTransaction(Transaction transaction, int numberProcessed, java.lang.String collection)
      Updates the number of collected coins that the user has transferred into their bank account for the current day, adds the value of gold from the transaction to the current value of gold, then updates this value on the users document.
      static void clearAllCoinsFromCollection(java.lang.String collection)
      This procedure removes all documents within the specified collection argument, and removes the coin from the corresponding ArrayList

      Initialise the document reference that will be used to identify the users document within firebase, and initialise local variables

      This procedure fetches all documents within the specified collection argument.
      static void retrieveAllFriends(OnEventListener<java.lang.String> event)
      Retrieves all documents in the users friends subcollection, then creates a User object for each document and stores the object in an ArrayList if the friend does not already exist in the list (this case arises when friends fragment calls this method to retrieve the most up to date friends list).
      static void retrieveAllRequests(OnEventListener<java.lang.String> event)
      Retrieves all documents in the users requests subcollection, then creates a User object for each document and stores the object in an ArrayList if the request does not already exist in the list (this case arises when friends fragment calls this method to retrieve the most up to date requests list).
      static void retrieveAllTransactions()
      Retrieves all documents in the users transactions subcollection, then creates a Transaction object for each document and stores the objects in an ArrayList
      static void retrieveExchangeRates(OnEventListener<java.lang.String> event)
      Retrieves rates data from firebase and sets the exchange rates HashMap, and informs caller of success or failure
      static void retrieveLeaderBoard(OnEventListener<java.lang.String> event)
      Finds all users from firebase, and an object is then created for each user so they can be placed on the global leader board.

      Removes coin from the collection it currently exists in, then places coin in the received subcollection of the specified friend.

      • retrieveExchangeRates

        public static void retrieveExchangeRates(OnEventListener<java.lang.String> event)
        Retrieves rates data from firebase and sets the exchange rates HashMap, and informs caller of success or failure

      • retrieveAllCoinsFromCollection

        public static void retrieveAllCoinsFromCollection(java.lang.String collection,
                                                  OnEventListener<java.lang.String> event)
        This procedure fetches all documents within the specified collection argument. It identifies the collection and stores the retrieved coins in their respective ArrayLists. The caller is notified if the procedure was a success or failure. In the case of received coins, this list will be updated every time the user goes into their wallet (so it is up to date if they have received coins from someone), so we add the coin to the received list if it does not already exist there

      • clearAllCoinsFromCollection

        public static void clearAllCoinsFromCollection(java.lang.String collection)
        This procedure removes all documents within the specified collection argument, and removes the coin from the corresponding ArrayList

      • addCoinToCollection

        public static void addCoinToCollection(Coin coin,
                                       java.lang.String collection,
                                       OnEventListener<java.lang.Integer> event)
        The specified coin is added to the specified collection and corresponding ArrayList. If the specified collection is "uncollected", then the method informs the caller of the number of uncollected coins it has currently added. This is so the caller can identify when all of it's uncollected coins have successfully been added to firebase. The method also informs the caller if the document fails to upload

      • removeCoinFromCollection

        public static void removeCoinFromCollection(Coin coin,
                                            java.lang.String collection,
                                            OnEventListener<java.lang.Integer> event)
        Removes the document corresponding to the coin argument in the specified collection, and the coin is also removed from the corresponding ArrayList. The caller is notified when the procedure has finished. This method returns the number of coins that have been removed from a collection for a bank transfer, however only the Wallet fragment will use this number

      • retrieveAllFriends

        public static void retrieveAllFriends(OnEventListener<java.lang.String> event)
        Retrieves all documents in the users friends subcollection, then creates a User object for each document and stores the object in an ArrayList if the friend does not already exist in the list (this case arises when friends fragment calls this method to retrieve the most up to date friends list). Caller is notified when procedure is complete

      • retrieveAllRequests

        public static void retrieveAllRequests(OnEventListener<java.lang.String> event)
        Retrieves all documents in the users requests subcollection, then creates a User object for each document and stores the object in an ArrayList if the request does not already exist in the list (this case arises when friends fragment calls this method to retrieve the most up to date requests list). Caller is notified when procedure is complete

      • retrieveAllTransactions

        public static void retrieveAllTransactions()
        Retrieves all documents in the users transactions subcollection, then creates a Transaction object for each document and stores the objects in an ArrayList

      • acceptFriendRequest

        public static void acceptFriendRequest(User friend)
        Performs three steps to accept a friend request: 1) Remove friend from users requests subcollection 2) Add friend to users friends subcollection 3) Add user to the requester's friends subcollection

      • declineFriendRequest

        public static void declineFriendRequest(User friend)
        Removes friend requester from users requests subcollection

      • sendFriendRequest

        public static void sendFriendRequest(java.lang.String email,
                                     OnEventListener<java.lang.String> event)
        Performs query to locate user with the specified email address. When located, the requester (this user) will be placed in the located users "requests" subcollection

      • sendCoinToFriend

        public static void sendCoinToFriend(User friend,
                                    Coin coin,
                                    java.lang.String collection,
                                    OnEventListener<java.lang.Integer> event)
        Removes coin from the collection it currently exists in, then places coin in the received subcollection of the specified friend. A random ID will be generated for the coin document. This is to avoid duplicate coin ID's in the case that two players send the same coin to a third player. Upon successful completion of sending the coin, the method caller is provided with the number of coins that have currently been transferred - this is so the caller can identify when all coins have been transferred

      • addTransaction

        public static void addTransaction(Transaction transaction,
                                  int numberProcessed,
                                  java.lang.String collection)
        Updates the number of collected coins that the user has transferred into their bank account for the current day, adds the value of gold from the transaction to the current value of gold, then updates this value on the users document. The transaction object is then added to the users transactions subcollection

      • retrieveLeaderBoard

        public static void retrieveLeaderBoard(OnEventListener<java.lang.String> event)
        Finds all users from firebase, and an object is then created for each user so they can be placed on the global leader board. If the user is also in the friends list, then they are added to the friends leader board

      • updateDate

        public static void updateDate(java.lang.String date)
        Updates the "lastSavedDate" field on firebase
